title: David Wood (actor)
text:
David Bernard Wood <a href="Order%20of%20the%20British%20Empire">OBE</a> (born 21 February 1944) is an English actor, author, composer, director, magician and producer. "<a href="The%20Times">The Times</a>" called him "the National Children's Dramatist". 
Early life.
Wood was born on 21 February 1944 in <a href="London%20Borough%20of%20Sutton">Sutton</a>, <a href="Surrey">Surrey</a>. He was educated at <a href="Chichester%20High%20School%20for%20Boys">Chichester High School for Boys</a> and <a href="Worcester%20College%2C%20Oxford">Worcester College, Oxford</a>.
Stage work.
Along with John Gould, he founded the <a href="Whirligig%20Theatre">Whirligig Theatre</a>, a touring children's theatre company.
His most famous story, "<a href="The%20Gingerbread%20Man%20%28musical%29">The Gingerbread Man</a>" (1976), has been all across the world since its premiere at the Towngate Theatre in <a href="Basildon">Basildon</a>. Wood, <a href="FilmFair">FilmFair</a>, and <a href="Central%20Independent%20Television">Central</a> adapted the musical into an animated <a href="children%27s%20television%20series">children's television series</a>. The adaptation, also called "<a href="The%20Gingerbread%20Man%20%28TV%20series%29">The Gingerbread Man</a>", aired on <a href="ITV%20%28TV%20network%29">ITV</a> in 1992.
He was appointed Officer of the <a href="Order%20of%20the%20British%20Empire">Order of the British Empire</a> (OBE) in the 2004 Queen's Birthday Honours List, for his services to literature and drama.
Film career.
Among his film roles are Johnny in <a href="Lindsay%20Anderson">Lindsay Anderson</a>'s "<a href="If...">If...</a>" (1968) and Thompson in "<a href="Aces%20High%20%28film%29">Aces High</a>" (1976). He appeared as the character Bingo Little in the original London cast of the <a href="Andrew%20Lloyd%20Webber">Andrew Lloyd Webber</a> and <a href="Alan%20Ayckbourn">Alan Ayckbourn</a> musical "<a href="By%20Jeeves">Jeeves</a>" in 1975.
He wrote the <a href="screenplay">screenplay</a> for <a href="Swallows%20and%20Amazons%20%281974%20film%29">the 1974 adaptation</a> of <a href="Arthur%20Ransome">Arthur Ransome</a>'s "<a href="Swallows%20and%20Amazons">Swallows and Amazons</a>", released by Anglo EMI.
